description: Moved to Canada with my parents and siblings
Graduated from Jeunes Sans Frontières high school. Scored the highest in an Information Technology course and second highest in 2 mathematics courses
Started my finance and computer science studies at the University of Toronto
Interned at HOOPP, a $94 billion pension fund. Worked with a team that built credit derivatives trading systems
Interned at Picton Mahoney Asset Management, a Toronto-based hedge fund entrusted with $6.6 billion in client assets
Participated in a competition for the first time. I represented my university and presented monetary policy recommendations to the Bank of Canada
Joined my university’s faculty as Teaching Assistant for my favorite 2nd, 3rd and 4th year courses.  Courses include finance, macroeconomics and statistics
Rejoined Picton Mahoney Asset Management for a second internship. This time, I worked for a quantitative fund manager
Won first place at AIMA’s portfolio construction competition
Won third place at Rotman’s algorithmic trading competition
Enrolled in a Udemy web development course and initiated the development of NestQ
Completed my studies in finance and computer science at the University of Toronto with a GPA of 3.9/4.0 in my last two years
